intro: Osmorhiza aristata var. brevistylis, commonly known as the short-styled sweetroot, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, parsley-like foliage. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. This variety is distinguished by its shorter stylus compared to other varieties of Osmorhiza aristata.
